trans.title: Mass production body welding positions and numbers (Outer panel, Japan production models)

item.ptxt: Welding symbols (The welding symbols with dashed lines have a meaning of the spot welding of the part which is not visible)
and : 2-Plate spot welding; and : 3-Plate spot welding; and : 4-Plate spot welding; : MAG plug welding; : MAG welding L=Welding length; unit: mm (in)
( ): The number of welds

This section explains the procedures after removal of all related parts. For the related parts' removal procedure, refer to the appropriate Shop Manual.
The component replacement procedure described here is only for new Honda-supplied parts, as needed, according to the area and the degree of damage on the body.
If there is any damage to the center pillar, cut the outer panel at the [A] position, pry off the outer panel, and replace it.
NOTE: Select the cutting positions in consideration of the front side outer panel repair part.
Replace the center pillar outer separator.
Check the side sill stiffener and the center pillar stiffener positions for damage. If necessary, replace them.
When removing the side sill stiffener, leave the front pillar lower stiffener and the center pillar stiffener in place.
Replace the center pillar inner separator.
When replacing the center pillar stiffener, cut the outer panel at the [B] and [C] positions.
When replacing the center pillar stiffener with the side sill stiffener removed, remove the center pillar stiffener complete and the center inner pillar as an assembly.
Replace the center pillar stiffener complete and the center inner pillar with new ones.

trans.title: Construction (Outer panel and center pillar stiffener, Except Japan production models)

item.ptxt: This section explains the procedures after removal of all related parts. For the related parts' removal procedure, refer to the appropriate Shop Manual.
The component replacement procedure described here is only for new Honda-supplied parts, as needed, according to the area and the degree of damage on the body.
If there is any damage to the center pillar, cut and pry off the outer panel, and replace it.
NOTE: Select the cutting positions in consideration of the front side outer panel repair part.
Replace the center pillar outer separator.
Check the center pillar stiffener position for damage. If necessary, replace it.
When replacing the center pillar stiffener, cut the outer panel at the [A] and [B] positions.
Replace the center pillar inner separator.

trans.title: Construction (Outer panel, side sill stiffener, and front pillar lower stiffener, Except Japan production models)

item.ptxt: This section explains the procedures after removal of all related parts. For the related parts' removal procedure, refer to the appropriate Shop Manual.
The component replacement procedure described here is only for new Honda-supplied parts, as needed, according to the area and the degree of damage on the body.
If there is any damage to the center pillar, cut the outer panel at the [A] position, pry off the outer panel, and replace it.
NOTE: Select the cutting positions in consideration of the front side outer panel repair part.
Replace the front pillar outer and center pillar outer separators.
Check the side sill stiffener position for damage. If necessary, replace it.
Remove the wheelhouse upper member, cut the outer panel at the [B] and [C] positions, and remove the front pillar lower stiffener.
Cut the [D] position of the center pillar stiffener, and remove the lower part of it. Remove the side sill stiffener complete.
Replace the front pillar inner and center pillar inner separators.
